content.title: AVM Embolization
content.description: Endovascular embolization techniques for arteriovenous malformations

key_concepts.details: Target nidus (central tangle) for cure; feeding vessel embolization alone ineffective and may worsen
Ethanol (most effective but highest risk), Onyx, n-BCA glue, coils
Superselective catheterization; staged procedures often required for large AVMs
Non-target embolization, skin/tissue necrosis, nerve injury, pulmonary embolism of agents

content.clinical_significance: Embolization is primary treatment for high-flow AVMs; cure rates 20-40%
content.statement: AVM Embolization is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Vascular-Malformations that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding AVM Embolization helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of AVM Embolization include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of AVM Embolization.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
